title: Emotional Support Design Process in Online Mathematics Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical knowledge and foundational simulation/VR tool utilization skills
context.additional_context: Project-based learning environment for practical mathematics problem-solving

learning_goals: Learners apply eight principles of emotional support design (positivity, playfulness, humanity, self-disclosure, safety, personalization, friendliness, intimacy) in a VR-based simulation environment to enhance learning motivation by 20% or more.

Learners can design a peer feedback system using online collaboration tools like Padlet or Google Jamboard, apply three or more emotional safety strategies (e.g., positive language, anonymous feedback options, shared feedback guidelines), and clearly explain the case to over 80% of peer evaluators.
Learners propose personalized learning interface optimization strategies by applying a customizable LX (Learner Experience) design framework.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
